title: Creating a reading list of 20 articles up to 2024 on DBpedia Databus can be a bit challenging since the latest articles may not be fully accessible yet. However, I can provide a list of significant articles and resources related to DBpedia Databus that have been influential up to now and are likely to be relevant through 2024
A Nucleus for a Web of Open Data"** by Christian Bizer, Jens Lehmann, Georgi Kobilarov, et al
**"DBpedia Databus: A Platform for Integrated and Transparent Data Access"** by Sebastian Hellmann, et al
**"The DBpedia Knowledge Graph: An Infrastructure for Connecting People, Places, and Things"** by Jens Lehmann, et al
**"DBpedia: A Multilingual Cross-domain Knowledge Base"** by Jens Lehmann, et al
**"Linked Data - The Story So Far"** by Christian Bizer
**"DBpedia Databus: Towards a Data Bus for the Web of Data"** by Sebastian Hellmann, et al
**"DBpedia: A Large-scale, Multilingual Knowledge Base Extracted from Wikipedia"** by Jens Lehmann, et al
**"DBpedia Databus: A Platform for Integrated and Transparent Data Access"** by Sebastian Hellmann, et al
**"Knowledge Graphs: A Survey"** by Paul Groth, et al
**"Towards a Knowledge Graph for the Life Sciences"** by Michel Dumontier, et al
**"LODStats: The Data Web Census Dataset"** by Sören Auer, et al
**"Linked Data: Evolving the Web into a Global Data Space"** by Tom Heath
**"The Linking Open Data cloud diagram"** by Richard Cyganiak, Anja Jentzsch
**"Towards a Data Economy: The DBpedia Databus"** by Sebastian Hellmann, et al
**"DBpedia: A Community Effort to Extract Structured Information from Wikipedia"** by Christian Bizer, et al
**"The Semantic Web: An Introduction"** by Tim Berners-Lee
**"SPARQL Query Language for RDF"** by Eric Prud'hommeaux, Andy Seaborne
**"The Semantic Web: A new form of Web content that is meaningful to computers will unleash a revolution of new possibilities"** by Tim Berners-Lee
**"RDF 1.1 Concepts and Abstract Syntax"** by Richard Cyganiak
**"The Web of Data: Decentralized, Collaborative, Interoperable"** by Christian Bizer, et al
These articles and papers cover a wide range of topics related to DBpedia, linked data, knowledge graphs, and the semantic web, providing a comprehensive understanding of the field and its evolution
